-----Original Message----- From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] Sent: Wednesday, February 07, 2007 12:10 AM To: DMCA Subject: [ThePlanetAbuse-C2966371C] Demand for Immediate Take Down - Notice of Infringing Activity - MS Ref. 84383 ==== Forwarded Ticket ==== 1. Demand for Immediate Take Down - Notice of Infringing Activity - MS Ref. 84383 Added by system at Wednesday, Feb 7 2007 06:08 am X-MailFrom: Internet4@Microsoft-Antipiracy.com X-RcptTo: abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net Received: from [216.12.192.67] by [216.12.192.78] (abacus) for ; Wed Feb 7 06:08:45 2007 Received: (qmail 10138 invoked by alias); 7 Feb 2007 12:08:45 -0000 Delivered-To: abuse@inbound.abacus.ev1servers.net Received: (qmail 10135 invoked from network); 7 Feb 2007 12:08:45 -0000 Received: from smtp02.theplanet.com (70.87.6.111) by inbound.abacus.ev1servers.net with SMTP; 7 Feb 2007 12:08:45 -0000 Received: from mail.theplanet.com ([216.185.111.52]) by smtp02.theplanet.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Wed, 7 Feb 2007 06:08:45 -0600 Return-path: Delivery-date: Wed, 07 Feb 2007 06:08:45 -0600 Received: from mx02.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.181] helo=mx02.filter.theplanet.com) by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from Internet4@Microsoft-Antipiracy.com) with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1HElbR-0000SZ-3J; Wed, 07 Feb 2007 06:08:45 -0600 Received: from mail.ciuexm.net ([213.208.96.3] helo=adsrv01.CIUEXM.NET) by mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from Internet4@Microsoft-Antipiracy.com) with esmtp (Exim) id 1HElbB-0000J1-HC; Wed, 07 Feb 2007 06:08:30 -0600 Subject: Demand for Immediate Take Down - Notice of Infringing Activity - MS Ref. 84383 MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="----_=_NextPart_001_01C74AAF.F233CFC4" Content-class: urn:content-classes:message Date: Wed, 7 Feb 2007 12:03:14 -0000 X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft Exchange V6.5.6944.0 Message-ID: <5EB28A2AFFC89F4686C426F38B9F7D7C3DA056@adsrv01.CIUEXM.NET> X-MS-Has-Attach: X-MS-TNEF-Correlator: Thread-Topic: Demand for Immediate Take Down - Notice of Infringing Activity - MS Ref. 84383 Thread-Index: AcdKr/GgVRppoXmrTBimkPLHt3fViA== From: "MSAntipiracy04" To: , X-OriginalArrivalTime: 07 Feb 2007 12:08:45.0364 (UTC) FILETIME=[B751CF40:01C74AB0] (multipart/alternative) Multipart prefix (text/plain) This is a multi-part message in MIME format. MIME element (text/plain) VIA EMAIL: Demand for Immediate Take-Down: Notice of Infringing Activity URL: http://blog.adglobe.net/2007/01/09/microsoft-office-2007-enterprise-and- application-key-generator/ CASE #: 84383 07 February 2007 Dear Sir or Madam, Microsoft has received information that the domain listed above, which appears to be on servers under your control, is offering unlicensed copies of, or is engaged in other unauthorized activities relating to copyrighted works published by Microsoft. 1. Identification of copyrighted works: Copyrighted work(s): Office Enterprise 2007 RTM Office Project Professional 2007 RTM Office Visio Professional 2007 RTM Copyright owner: Microsoft Corporation 2. Copyright infringing material or activity found at the following location(s): http://blog.adglobe.net/2007/01/09/microsoft-office-2007-enterprise-and- application-key-generator/ The above location is offering 'Cracks' or 'Product Keys', intended to circumvent technical measures that control access to Microsoft's copyrighted works and that protect Microsoft's copyrights in those works. 3. Statement of authority: The information in this notice is accurate, and I hereby certify under penalty of perjury that I am authorized to act on behalf of Microsoft, the owner of the copyright(s) in the work(s) identified above. I have a good faith belief that none of the materials or activities listed above have been authorized by Microsoft, its agents, or the law. We hereby give notice of these activities to you and request that you take expeditious action to remove or disable access to the material described above, and thereby prevent the unauthorized distribution of these cracks or product keys via your company's network. We appreciate your cooperation in this matter. Please advise us regarding what actions you take. Yours sincerely, Martin J. Green Internet Investigator on behalf of Microsoft Corporation One Microsoft Way Redmond, WA 98052 United States of America E-mail: Internet4@microsoft-antipiracy.com MIME element (text/html)

VIA EMAIL:

Demand for Immediate Take-Down: Notice of Infringing Activity

URL: http://blog.adglobe.net/2007/01/09/mic rosoft-office-2007-enterprise-and-application-key-generator/
CASE #: 84383

07 February 2007

Dear Sir or Madam,

Microsoft has received information that the domain listed above, which appears to be on servers under your control, is offering unlicensed copies of, or is engaged in other unauthorized activities relating to copyrighted works published by Microsoft.

1. Identification of copyrighted works:

Copyrighted work(s):
Office Enterprise 2007 RTM
Office Project Professional 2007 RTM
Office Visio Professional 2007 RTM

Copyright owner:
Microsoft Corporation

2. Copyright infringing material or activity found at the following location(s): http://blog.adglobe.net/2007/01/09/mic rosoft-office-2007-enterprise-and-application-key-generator/< /P>

The above location is offering 'Cracks' or 'Product Keys', intended to circumvent technical measures that control access to Microsoft's copyrighted works and that protect Microsoft's copyrights in those works.

3. Statement of authority:

The information in this notice is accurate, and I hereby certify under penalty of perjury that I am authorized to act on behalf of Microsoft, the owner of the copyright(s) in the work(s) identified above.  I have a good faith belief that none of the materials or activities listed above have been authorized by Microsoft, its agents, or the law.

We hereby give notice of these activities to you and request that you take expeditious action to remove or disable access to the material described above, and thereby prevent the unauthorized distribution of these cracks or product keys via your company's network.

We appreciate your cooperation in this matter. Please advise us regarding what actions you take.

Yours sincerely,

Martin J. Green
Internet Investigator

on behalf of Microsoft Corporation
One Microsoft Way
Redmond, WA 98052
United States of America

E-mail: Internet4@microsoft-antipiracy.com

MIME element (text/plain)
